item.title: Bulletin updated at 13:16 HKT 03/09/2023
item.description:
At 1 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 32 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 66 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 11
Intensity of UV radiation : extreme
The public is advised to avoid prolonged exposure under the sun to prevent damage to skin and eyes.

Tropical Cyclone Haikui has entered within 800 kilometres of Hong Kong, and will move across the southern part of Taiwan today (3 September). According to the present forecast track, Haikui will enter the Taiwan Strait tomorrow (4 September) and then move towards the vicinity of the coast of eastern Guangdong to southern Fujian, but its movement remains uncertain. The Observatory will consider issuing the Standby Signal, No. 1 tomorrow morning. Members of the public please take note of the latest weather forecast.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning was issued at 1:15 p.m. The public should beware of heat stroke and drink more water.
